title: Prep profile: Valders’ Taylor Zucchi
text:
Prep profile: Valders’ Taylor Zucchi Tom Dombeck , HTR Media 6:54 p.m. CDT October 12, 2015 Valders' Taylor Zucchi is featured in this week's HTR Media's prep profile Valders’ freshman cross country runner Taylor Zucchi poses for a prep profile portrait Wednesday in Valders. (Photo: Tom Dombeck/HTR Media) 96 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Sports Taylor competes in 
To go to State. 
Taylor’s thoughts 
“I didn’t ever expect to come this far, I was just happy to make it and be on varsity and then it just sort of turned into more than that. My goal was to catch Abby DeMeyer the senior girl on our team and it turned into a bit more than that. I’ve started to take in the top five in most of my races and I think I’ve done a good job. I feel really great. I’m excited to see my senior year and see what it really looks like if I’m doing this good as a freshman.” 
Coach Bill Dietrich’s thoughts 
“She is having a phenomenal season, it’s one of those learning curves where she jumps from the middle school race which is 1.5 miles to the high school race which is 5K. Sometimes they adapt very easily and sometimes it’s a tough transition but after the first three races she’s worked with Abby DeMeyer who is a senior captain and that all pulled each other through. There’s like four of them running in a pack and that made it easy for her. It’s very rare but she’s been doing a lot of prep work. She’s been on the cross country team since she was in fifth grade.” 
Taylor’s favorites 
•Song of all time: “Don’t stop believing” by Journey 
•TV show: “Castle” 
•Class: Gym 
•Food: Pizza 
•Saying or piece of advice: “I don’t stop when I’m tired, I stop when I’m done.” 
•Hobby: Snowmobiling 
What if ... 
•You could be any celebrity on earth for a week. Who would it be? Jennifer Aniston 
You could listen to a song minutes before the biggest athletic event of your life to get you hyped. What would it be? “Thunderstruck” by AC/DC 
•You could meet one famous person, a non-athlete, who would it be? Jennifer Aniston 
Quick Q&A 
•Who inspires you most? Valders cross country coach Bill Dietrich 
•What is your dream vacation destination? Jamaica 
•What’s your No. 1 pet peeve? Nails on a chalkboard. 
•What do you want to do for a living? Registered nurse 
•Why are sports important to you? It teaches me to be a better person, to work hard and to never give up. 
•What’s your strength as a person? Being a runner. 
•What do you still need to work on? In races, catching the people in front of me. 
•Top person you follow, or would follow, on Twitter? Former US Olympic long distance runner PattiSue Plumer
